meanings.definition: The quality or state of being morbid.
meanings.sent1: Her constant focus on death and illness showed a deep morbidness.
meanings.sent2: The morbidness of the horror movie made it difficult to watch.
meanings.sent3: Despite his morbidness, he still found joy in simple things like funny movies.
meanings.sent4: The morbidness of the situation hung over them like a dark cloud.
meanings.sent5: The morbidness of the abandoned house sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: An abnormal or unhealthy interest in disturbing or unpleasant subjects.
meanings.sent1: Her morbidness led her to seek out gruesome stories and images.
meanings.sent2: The morbidness of his thoughts often kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent3: Despite his morbidness, he still had a lighthearted sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The morbidness of the crime scene was overwhelming for the detectives.
meanings.sent5: The morbidness of the conversation made everyone uncomfortable.
